intro: Dipterygia philippiana, commonly known as the Philippine dipterygia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody structure. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. It has simple, alternate leaves with a rough texture and produces small, yellowish-green flowers. Dipterygia philippiana is often found in lowland and montane regions, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
